Matt stood up suddenly causing Natalie to instinctively take a step back. Matt walked round and sat on the front edge of his desk, putting himself at eye level with Natalie who was standing an arm's length from him.

"Y'see Natalie," her boss continued, arms folded, "the people who draft these contracts are very clever at hiding their intentions within heavily worded content. They usually put these phrases several pages into the contract in the hope that the intended recipient has got bored of reading it by then and doesn't give it much thought."

"C'mon Natalie, read it to me." Matt said, with a grin.

"The signatory is under the governance of her Executive Producer and must conform to whatever he/she deems appropriate for each broadcast in which he/she is involved. The Executive Producer has complete control of all aspects of the broadcast."

Matt could tell by her expression that Natalie was quickly thinking what this ambiguous paragraph could mean in relation to her but he was too excited to wait for her to work it out.

"It sounds so innocent, doesn't it?" he smiled, "Surely it just states that I am your boss, you are my employee and therefore I run the broadcast and you do what I say, right?
